G4655-d-11-26-99-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
G4655-d-11-26-99-WC.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
G4655-d-11-26-99-WC.Narrative: SWITCH CREW ON YARD JOB, FY1976, WAS HEADING WEST ON THE LEAD WITH 21 LOADS AND 21 EMPTIES AT APPROXIMATELY 4 MPH IN THE GREEN BAY YARD.  AT THE SAME TIME, THE SWITCH CREW ON YARD JOB, FY1973, HAD GONE INTO TRACK 551 AND MADE A JOINT ON A CAR IN THE TRACK.  THE CONDUCTOR ON FY1973 DID NOT PROTECT HIS SHOVE MOVE ON TRACK 551 CAUSING THE REAR CAR TO BE SHOVED OUT IN FRONT OF FY1976.  FY1973 HAD STOPPED THEIR MOVE JUST BEFORE THE IMPACT OCCURRED BETWEEN THE ENGINE ON FY1976 AND THE REAR CAR ON FY1973.  FY1976 DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH TIME TO STOP THEIR MOVE PRIOR TO IMPACT DUE TO THE FACT THAT THE CARWAS SHOVED OUT RIGHT IN FRONT OF THEM.  NOTHING WAS DERAILED IN THE INCIDENT HOWEVER, THE ENGINE AND CAR INVOLVED BOTH SUSTAINED DAMAGE.  THE ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT REPORTED NO TRACK DAMAGE.  CREW MEMBERS WERE TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4648-d-11-29-99-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure engine(s) (railroad employee)
G4648-d-11-29-99-WC.Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure engine(s) (railroad employee)
G4648-d-11-29-99-WC.Narrative: THE CREW ON T005 HAD CUT TWO LOCOMOTIVES OFF AND LEFT THEM ON THE MAINLINE TRACK WITH ONE HAND BRAKETIED ON.  THE CREW THEN WENT INTO SIDING TO PICK UP ANOTHER LOCOMOTIVE AND SET OUT ONE THAT THEY HAD.  WHILE THE CREW WAS IN THE SIDING, THE TWO STANDING LOCOMOTIVES (SP 335 & WC 6607) ROLLED INTO THE SIDE OF ENGINE WC 6583.  THE THREE ENGINE DID NOT DERAIL BUT DID SUSTAIN DAMAGE IN THE INCIDENT.THE MAIN LINE TRACK WAS ALSO TIPPED.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE ACCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CONDUCTOR HAD FAILED TO PROPERLY SECURE BOTH THE ENGINES THAT WERE LEFT ON THE MAIN LINE TRACK, ALLOWING THEM TO ROLL BACK INTO THEIR TRAIN IN THE SIDING.  THE CREW WAS TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

155462-d-11-28-99-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 2407 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SHOVING 32 LOADS EASTWARD INTO CARGILL #2 TRACK, WITH CONDUCTOR RIDING THE POINT OF THE MOVEMENT.  WHEN THE MOVEMENT CAME TO A STOP, LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER ADVISED CONDUCTOR THAT HE HAD NOT INITIATED THE STOP AND INQUIRED IF THE AIR WAS SET UP ON THE END CARS.  AFTER CONFIRMING THAT THE BRAKES WERE ALL RELEASED, CONDUCTOR PROCEEDED TO WALK WESTWARD, INSPECTING THE TRAIN, WHEN HE OBSERVED THE 9TH THROUGH 12TH CARS (INCLUSIVE) FROM THE LEAD END (IN DIRECTION OF TRAVEL) DERAILED.  ALL DERAILED CARS REMAINED UPRIGHT, WITH NO LOSS OF PRODUCT.  INDUSTRY TRACK EXPENSES IS ESTIMATED TO BE $500.  CORRECTIVE ACTION, INCLUDING DISCIPLINE MEETING SET UP WITH LOCAL FOPS, MRO, SA MGR, TMS AND CARGILL'S ELEVATOR MANAGER TO DETERMINE CORRECTIVE ACTION TO PREVENT FUTURE OCCURRENCE.   TMS BOCK PERFORMED ES INSPECTION OF CARGILL'S TRACK; MADE CURSORY INITIAL RECOMMENDATIONS AND WILL FOLLOW UP WITH WRITTEN PROPOSAL FOR OVERALL PLAN.   CARGILL TO FIX TRACK DEFICIENCIES AND ESTABLISH LONG TERM REHAB PROGRAM BASED ON TMS RECOMMENDATIONS.  PRESENT SERVICE RESTRICTION; LIMITED TO 32 CAR CUTS AND 5 MPH REVIEWED.  UNTIL TRACK FIXED TO STANDARD, ADDITIONAL SWITCH CHARGE TO BE APPLIED.NoneNone
